properties.name: Achievement System Example
properties.description: A simple achievement system for players while playing the game.
properties.author: ISS PRODUCTIONS

objects.name: FooterText
objects.string: Made for the GDevelop Examples Jam #1 by ISS PRODUCTIONS

events.comment:
Welcome to my example for Achievements System in GDevelop!
// This is the enhanced version of my example game which includes a simple indicator when a player earned a specific achievement.
// When the cursor touches either the StartGameButton or AchievementsMenuButton text object, set the text style of each text object to italic and bold to show interactivity.
// When the player clicks on either StartGameButton or AchievementsMenuButton text object, the game will proceed to go to the respective scenes.

objects.name: ExitText
objects.string:
Press Escape to return to main menu.
Hint: Red - Player | Yellow - Coin | Purple - Enemy

events.comment:
This is the Game Screen where I made a simple mini game to demonstrate how players can unlock achievements during game play.
When the scene starts, save the position of the player.
Updates to the player's gameplay statistics (scores) to track the player's progress for all achievements.
When the player dies (fall outside of screen), add 1 to the number of times the player died global variable.
When the player completed an achievement, a simple indicator telling the player that they have earned it will be shown.
When the player collects a coin, the coin will be removed and a value of 50 will be added to the number of coins collected global variable.
When the player completed an achievement, a simple indicator telling the player that they have earned it will be shown.
When the player hits an enemy, the enemy will be removed and a value of 1 will be added to the number of enemies killed global variable.
When the player completed an achievement, a simple indicator telling the player that they have earned it will be shown.
When the player presses the Escape key, the game will stop and return to the main screen.

objects.name: SceneTitleDescription
objects.string: Your earned achievements will be displayed here.

objects.name: Achievement2Description
objects.string: Kill a minimum of 10 enemies in multiple playthroughs.

objects.name: Achievement3Description
objects.string: Die at least 10 times in multiple playthroughs.

objects.name: Achievement1Description
objects.string: Collect a minimum of 500 coins in multiple playthroughs.

events.comment:
This is the Achievements Screen where the player's achievements earned from the game screen can be seen here.
Check the global variables for all achievements every time the player accesses this screen.
If the collected player stats equal of more than the achievement's requirement, change the text object to 'Complete!' to show the player that the achievement has been achieved.
When the cursor touches the BackButton text object, set the text style to italic and bold to show interactivity.
When the cursor is not touching the BackButton text object, set the style of the text back to normal.
When the player clicks the BackButton text object, go back to the main screen.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/) and Entropy (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UClvkb12nOWFgWnQ56NF9Rcw)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will reduce opacity and size (if desired), the Z-value and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.

This extension can be used to:

- Make an object look faster, such as during a speed powerup.  
- Give a 3D-like feel to a character
- Implement unique time-based elements, like teleporting a character back to a previous location
- Simulate the movement of a caterpillar or slinky
- Recreate games like snake or tron

These object variables are provided to manage the shadow clones:

- ShadowCloneOrder: Shadow clone identifier, where 1 is the shadow clone closest to the primary object
- FramesBehindPrimary: The number of frames that the shadow clone is behind the primary object

Notes: 
- For shadow clones to work, this action must be run every frame.
- The ShadowCloneObject cannot be the PrimaryObject, but it can be a duplicate object. 
- For animations to work, the PrimaryObject and ShadowCloneObject must use the same animation numbers.

Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/2t4ANYgrrak) to see examples of how to use this extension.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShadowClones
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create and animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object.

eventsFunctions.description: Select the primary object, the shadow clone object, the number of shadow clones, the number of frames between shadow clones, the rate that shadow clones will fade away (if desired), the Z-value of the shadow clones, and the layer the shadow clones will be created on.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Animate shadow clones that follow the path of a primary object
eventsFunctions.name: AnimateShadowClones
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create and animate _PARAM3_ copies of _PARAM2_ that follow the position of _PARAM1_, with _PARAM4_ empty frames between shadow clones, and fading the opacity of shadow clones by _PARAM5_ per clone.  Shrink scale of shadow clones by _PARAM6_ per clone. Shadow clones will be created on _PARAM7_ layer with a Z-value of _PARAM8_.  Match X scale: _PARAM9_  Match Y scale: _PARAM10_  Match angle: _PARAM11_  Match animation: _PARAM12_  Match animation frame: _PARAM13_

events.comment: Read input variables
Fix default value (min=1)
Calculate the max frames behind the primary that a shadow will exist
Create the right number of shadow clones (but only when there is position data)
Create shadow clones and link them to the primary object

events.name: Change shadow clones based on the history of the PrimaryObject

events.comment: Move shadow clones
Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Change opacity of shadow clone (if requested)
Shrink shadow clones (if requested)
Delete shadow clone if we have decreased number of shadow clones.  Reset counter variable.
Clean-up unused history
Reset temp variable for iterating through child objects
Move position history to the next higher index, starting from the highest number (FramesBehind-1)
Move object history to one higher frame
Record new current position in index = 1
Read input variables
Fix default value (min=1)
Calculate the max frames behind the primary that a shadow will exist
Create the right number of shadows
Create shadow clones at proper intervals and link them to the primary object
Copy current state of PrimaryObject
Set fade
Set scale
Move shadow clones
Move shadow clones
Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Only change scale if ShrinkSpeed has not been set
Update FramesBehindPrimary if the FramesBetweenShadowClones has changed
Delete shadow clone if we have decreased number of shadow clones or changed distance between clones.  Reset counter variable.
Don't let counter go negative
Don't let counter go negative
Change opacity of shadow clone
Set scale
Clean-up unused history
Reset temp variable for iterating through child objects
Move position history to the next higher index, starting from the highest number (FramesBehind-1)
Move object history to one higher frame
Record new current position in index = 1

parameters.description: Object that shadow clones will follow
parameters.name: PrimaryObject

parameters.description: Shadows clones will be made of this object (Cannot be the same object used for primary object)
parameters.name: ShadowCloneObject

parameters.description: Number of empty frames between shadow clones (Default: 1)
parameters.name: FramesBetweenShadowClones

parameters.longDescription: Decrease in opacity for each consecutive shadow clone
parameters.name: FadeSpeed

parameters.longDescription: Decrease in scale for each consecutive shadow clone
parameters.name: ShrinkSpeed

parameters.description: Shadow clones will be created on this layer. (Default: "") (Base Layer)
parameters.name: ShadowCloneLayer

parameters.description: Z value for created shadow clones
parameters.name: ShadowCloneZValue

parameters.description: Match X scale of primary object:
parameters.name: MatchScaleX

parameters.description: Match Y scale of primary object:
parameters.name: MatchScaleY

parameters.description: Match animation frame of primary object:
parameters.name: MatchAnimationFrame

eventsFunctions.description: Delete shadow clone objects that are linked to a primary object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Delete shadow clone objects that are linked to a primary object
eventsFunctions.name: DeleteShadowClones
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delete all _PARAM2_ that are linked to _PARAM1_

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Elairyx, @Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allows to set up checkpoints for each instance.
Checkpoint coordinates are dynamic values so can be object positions absolute/relative values and more.
Checkpoints can then be used to move the same or even other instances to them.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkpoints

eventsFunctions.description: Update a checkpoint of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: SaveCheckpoint

eventsFunctions.description: Change the position of the object to the saved checkpoint.
eventsFunctions.name: LoadCheckpoint

parameters.longDescription: Loading not yet saved checkpoints will (by default) set the position to the coordinate 0;0. Select "yes" to completely ignore non-existant checkpoints. To define an alternative checkpoint for it, create a new event and use the "Checkpoint exists" condition, save the wanted checkpoint as the action.
parameters.name: SetIgnoreUndefined

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a checkpoint has a position saved / does exist.
eventsFunctions.name: CheckpointExist
